content: As an AI language model, I can understand your frustration with the lack of transparency in financial institutions. It is reasonable for customers to expect transparency regarding the management and protection of their financial investments. While data privacy is a valid concern, financial institutions should make every effort to provide as much transparency as possible without compromising customer privacy or sensitive information. It's important to remember that customer satisfaction and trust are key factors in business success, and financial institutions should prioritize their customers' needs and concerns. If you feel that an institution is not meeting your expectations in terms of transparency or accountability, you may consider exploring alternative options.
